Origins: On 12 November 2014, the Twitter account @EarthBeauties posted a doctored photo of a satanic leaf-tailed gecko:
Description: While the satanic leaf-tailed gecko (Uroplatus phantasticus) is a real animal, it does not actually have wings. Those dragon-like appendages were added to a photograph taken by author, entomologist, and photographer Piotr Naskrecki. Naskrecki, who is also the photographer behind the amazing " puppy-sized spider " photos, posted the unaltered images of the satanic gecko on his blog The Smaller Majority on 22 September 2012: The gecko grew wings about a year later when the photograph was posted to the Hybrid Animals subreddit : This is a subreddit for photoshop cross-breeding, not for posting random creatures or monsters in general. Create new animals by combining species with each other and/or with any other stuff you find appropriate. Using Photoshop. The photo began spreading on the Internet, and on 9 June 2013 it received a big viral push when it was retweeted by the Game Of Thrones Twitter account: DRACARYS! RT @fascinatingpics Satanic leaf-tailed Gecko. It's like a real life Dragon! http://t.co/MytwFSH0Qw Game Of Thrones (@GameOfThrones) June 9, 2013 The doctored photograph of the satanic leaf-tailed gecko has seen a few spikes in popularity since it first went viral in 2013, and it will likely see a few more surges over the years. But regardless of how many times the photo goes viral, this gecko will never be a member of the dragon family.
Example: [Collected via e-mail, November 2014] Satanic leaf tailed gecko photos are popping up that look incredibly shopped but I haven't found any credible source for rebuttal.
Claim: The satanic leaf-tailed gecko has wings like a dragon.
